instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.C7050: What is C7050? Capacitor between current sense lines on ISL6259 chip for battery current sensing, you should measure around 2.202 ohms across this. Often when the resistance across this capacitor is higher it is because one of the current sense resistors going to the ISL6259 chip has failed. When current sensing resistors between the shunt resistor and the ISL6259 power IC have failed the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.C7020: What is C7020? Capacitor between current sense lines on ISL6259 chip for charger current sensing, you should measure around 20.02 ohms across this. Often when the resistance across this capacitor is higher it is because one of the current sense resistors going to the ISL6259 chip has failed. When current sensing resistors between the shunt resistor and the ISL6259 power IC have failed the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing as much power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v on both port
threads.message:
Hi, this machine came in dead, with 5v on both port, consuming about 30-40ma

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> is fine
ppbus not shorted
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> 3.4v
<SIGNAL>BUF_SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> 3.4v


Both of the <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> missing pp1v1 ldo, <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> has been replaced with KNOWN GOOD chip, still the same. 
any pointer ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v on both port
threads.message:
Any history about how the fault appeard?
What about <SIGNAL>SMC_RST_IN</SIGNAL>?

Check <SIGNAL>SMC_USBC_INT_L</SIGNAL> signal.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v on both port
threads.message:
clean board, customer as usual just say nothing happen it just dead some day..
<SIGNAL>SMC_RST_IN</SIGNAL> 0v
<SIGNAL>SMC_USBC_INT_L</SIGNAL> 3.3v

have tried removing the redriver chip too, but still same problem

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v on both port
threads.message: does this machine need <CHIP>U2800</CHIP> to switch to 20v ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v on both port
threads.message:
Machine can work without <CHIP>U2800</CHIP>.
But will loss USB activity once macOS is loaded.

Post <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> basic voltages; <SIGNAL>P_IN</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>AUX_DET</SIGNAL>, VDDA/P, <SIGNAL>AUX_OK</SIGNAL>, A/BMON.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v on both port
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v on both port
threads.message:
"ppbus not shorted"
Can we give real diode mode readings?
Check in both directions, please.

Remove F7000 and check <CAPACITOR>C7050</CAPACITOR> voltage.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v on both port
threads.message:
diode mode 0.430 on both side of F7000.
with f7000 removed, <CAPACITOR>C7050</CAPACITOR> voltage is 0.2v ..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v on both port
threads.message: resistance between pin 1 and 2 of <CAPACITOR>C7020</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C7023</CAPACITOR> is 2 ohm respectively, if that matters

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v on both port
threads.message:
found <DIODE>D3402</DIODE> blown. but the line is not shorted.
found <SIGNAL>USBC_XB_D2R_P</SIGNAL> shorted, from <CHIP>U2800</CHIP>.
pulled <CHIP>U2800</CHIP>, and mac boot with 20v,
just need to pull another chip and install it to the mac, thank you so muchh for the pointer
